title: Did you know?
text:
The Peñafrancia Festival in Naga City is one of the largest Marian celebrations in the Philippines, honoring Our Lady of Peñafrancia, the patroness of the Bikol Region. It draws pilgrims from across the country for the novena, processions, and fluvial parade that fill the city with devotion, music, and community spirit.

Traditionally held every September, the festival features the Traslación (transfer of the image), the solemn processions, and the iconic river procession where thousands of devotees accompany the image along the Naga River. It is a defining cultural and religious event that showcases Bikol’s faith and hospitality.
